comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: The sticker and scratched in mirror view it is read 5/13/15 (May 13, 1915)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Theodore Roosevelt was sued for libel by a political enemy, and the trial was held between 4-25-15 and 5-23-15 in Syracuse, New York. Roosevelt won the case. The trial was heavily covered by the press, so I suppose this is Teddy and the press boys assigned to his trial, outside the courthouse. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50E1FF73F5D1A72...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The reporter second from left in the back row appears to be James J. Montague who covered the trial for anti-Roosevelt Hearst newspapers. A Roosevelt biographer wrote: ""At the Barnes-Roosevelt libel trial in Syracuse I came across James J. Montague, a hardened reporter on a highly anti-Roosevelt newspaper, walking up and down and cursing. I asked him what moved him to these expletives. 'Roosevelt, damn him,' said Montague; 'I can't keep hating him if I get anywhere within twenty feet of him, and I'm always accidentally doing it. He's spoiling my story." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_J._Montague

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: artolog:  Thanks.  It does look like Montague.  We'll add his name to the description next time we update.

comment.author: 101241910@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anne_loc] I own the original photo, it is sealed and framed. Theodore Roosevelt and all the press men have signed the bottom of the photograph. That is most certainly James J. Montague he signed the photograph J J Montague.
